entry.summary: I discuss the role of the Higgs boson as a probe of dark matter and inflation.

entry.title: QCD renormalization for the top-quark mass in a mass geometrical mean hierarchy
entry.summary: $QCD$ renormalization for the top-quark mass is calculated in a mass geometrical mean hierarchy, $m_d m_b = m_s^2$ and $m_u m_t = m_c^2$. The physical mass, $m_t(m_t) = 160 {\pm} 50 GeV$ is obtained, which agrees very well with electroweak precision measurement.

entry.title: Confinement in a Chromoelectric Vacuum
entry.summary: A chromoelectric vacuum that confines both gluon and quark degrees of freedom (in the sense that they do not exist as asymptotic states) is constructed. However some degrees of freedom still exist as asymptotic states thereby allowing colour singlets to propagate.

entry.title: Running Nonlocal Lagrangians
entry.summary: We investigate the renormalization of ``nonlocal'' interactions in an effective field theory using dimensional regularization with minimal subtraction. In a scalar field theory, we write an integro-differential renormalization group equation for every possible class of graph at one loop order.

entry.title: Interpretation of Precision Measurements in the Strongly Interacting Limit of the Standard Electroweak Model
entry.summary: Strong rescattering corrections to one-loop contributions to the parameters of the standard electroweak model are considered.

entry.title: Complex Effective Potentials and Critical Bubbles
entry.summary: The Higgs contribution to the effective potential appears to be complex. How do we interpret this, and how should we modify the calculation to calculate physical quantities such as the critical bubble free energy?

entry.summary: Wrong preprint number changed on previous version.

entry.summary: We introduce two new sets of invariant functions of quark mass matrices, which express the constraints on these mass matrices due to knowledge of the quark mixing matrix. These invariants provide a very simple method to test candidate forms for mass matrices.

entry.summary: I review the spin dependent structure functions which control dominant (twist-2) and sub-dominant (twist-3) phenomena in hard processes. Novel effects associated with chirally odd parton distributions and with transverse polarization are emphasized.

entry.summary: We show that there is an anologous Aharonov-Casher effect on a neutral particle with electric dipole moment interacting with a magnetic filed produced by magnetic monopoles.

Grand unification with and without supersymmetry is considered, including possible evidence from coupling constant unification and implications for proton decay and neutrino mass.

entry.summary: Cosmological models which predict a large amount of antimatter in the Universe are reviewed. Observational signatures and searches for cosmic antimatter are briefly considered. A short discussion of new long range forces which might be associated with matter and antimatter is presented.

entry.title: Disoriented Chiral Condensates: A White Paper for the Full Acceptance Detector at the SSC

entry.summary: We present QCD results for the exclusive processes $\gamma{\rm N}\rightarrow\gamma{\rm N}$ ($\rm N=p,\;n$) at large momentum transfer and compare them to data for the proton. TALK given at DPF meeting, November 10-14, Fermilab.

entry.title: Beyond the Standard Model
entry.summary: The standard model of particle physics is marvelously successful. However, it is obviously not a complete or final theory. I shall argue here that the structure of the standard model gives some quite concrete, compelling hints regarding what lies beyond.

entry.summary: Definitions of the control sequences included, but no other changes.

entry.title: Chiral Perturbation Theory
entry.summary: The basic ideas and power counting rules of chiral perturbation theory are discussed. The formalism of velocity dependent fields for baryons, and for hadrons containing a heavy quark, is explained. (Invited Talk, 1993 QCD Rencontres de Moriond)

entry.title: Symmetric Textures
entry.summary: I present an algorithm in the search for symmetric textures in the quark Yukawa matrices. This is based on a talk at the Coral Gables conference in January 1993. I include the macro tables2.tex for making tables, and use the Santa Barbara jnl and reforder macros.

entry.title: On Quark Confinement
entry.summary: A sufficient condition for the confinement of quarks is presented. Quarks are shown to be unobservable. Colour singlets are however, observables. The results of deep inelastic scattering are discussed. We argue that QCD does not exhibit a deconfining transition.

entry.title: Beyond the black disk limit
entry.summary: We consider consequences of violation of the black disk limit possibly revealed by the new CDF measurements of the total, elastic and diffractive cross--sections.

entry.title: The SUSY World
entry.summary: Summary Talk of the Workshop `Properties of SUSY particles' Erice, September 28 -- October 4, 1992.
entry.arxiv:comment: 23 pages, 6 figures (not included), CERN-TH.6951/93, LATEX using worldsci.sty macro, hardcopy with figures can be sent via air-mail upon request

entry.title: CP Violation Induced by Supersymmetry in $e^+e^-$ Collisions
entry.summary: We discuss the possibility of observing $CP$ violation predicted by the supersymmetric standard model.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, Plain TeX (Talk given at the Workshop on Physics and Experiments with Linear $e^+e^-$ Colliders)

entry.title: Top Confinement
entry.summary: A new interaction that confines the top quark at the electroweak scale is proposed to account for a top quark mass potentially close in value to the electroweak scale.

entry.title: Neutrinos at high energy accelerators
entry.summary: PREAMBLE, BRIEF HISTORY AND PRELIMINARIES, QUICK REVIEW OF BASIC NEUTRINO PROPERTIES, CHARGED CURRENT NEUTRINO PROCESSES, NEUTRAL CURRENT NEUTRINO PROCESSES, VERY HEAVY NEUTRINOS, CONCLUDING SUMMARY
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTex; No. of pages 32, no. of figures 20 - not included, available on request (e-mail: probir@tifrvax)

entry.title: Parton-Parton Elastic Scattering and Rapidity Gaps at SSC and LHC Energies
entry.summary: The theory of the perturbative pomeron, due to Lipatov and collaborators, is used to compute the probability of observing parton-parton elastic scattering and rapidity gaps between jets in hadron collisions at SSC and LHC energies.

entry.title: Parton-Parton Elastic Scattering and Rapidity Gaps at Tevatron Energies
entry.summary: The theory of the perturbative pomeron, due to Lipatov and collaborators, is used to compute the probability of observing parton-parton elastic scattering and rapidity gaps between jets in hadron collisions at Tevatron energies.

entry.title: Searching for $t\to ch^0$ or $h^0\to t\bar c$ at $e^+e^-$ Linear Colliders
entry.summary: Talk presented at 2nd International Workshop on Physics and Experiments with Linear $e^+e^-$ Colliders (Hawaii, April 1993).

entry.title: Extended Gauge Sectors at Linear Colliders
entry.summary: Signatures of extended gauge models at high energy \epem\ linear colliders are summarized. Talk presented at the Workshop on Physics and Experiments with Linear \epem\ Colliders, Waikoloa, Hawaii, April 1993.
entry.arxiv:comment: 24 pages (figures + text, figures available by request), LaTex, ANL-HEP-CP-93-68

entry.title: Common Origin for the Solar and Atmospheric Neutrino Deficits
entry.summary: Some typos corrected, slightly different abstract, same plots, results and conclusions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 Latex pages, 3 figures attached as postscript files, IFP-472-UNC, PRL-TH-93/13

entry.title: Introduction to Chiral Perturbation Theory
entry.summary: An introduction to the basic ideas and methods of Chiral Perturbation Theory is presented. Several phenomenological applications of the effective Lagrangian technique to strong, electromagnetic and weak interactions are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 46 pages, 4 figures (appended at the end), CERN-TH.6978/93

entry.title: Large N Relations Between Mass Matrix And Gauge Group In Electroweak Gauge Extensions With Strong Coupling
entry.summary: The Large N expansion in gauge models with an NJL mechanism is discussed in view of the resulting fermionic mass matrix. A hidden symmetry model is introduced.

entry.title: Beyond the Standard Model in Tau Decays
entry.summary: Invited talk at Second Workshop on JINR CTau Factory, Dubna, April 1993, updated version of earlier review given at Second Workshop on Tau Lepton Physics, Ohio, september 1992
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, 5 figures, FTUV/93-38, printed copies available upon request

entry.title: Vector and Scalar Meson Resonances in $K\rightarrowπππ$ Decays
entry.summary: Corrections to $K\rightarrow\pi\pi\pi$ induced by vector and scalar meson exchange are investigated within chiral perturbation theory.

entry.title: Higgs Sector Motivations for an e-minus e-minus Linear Collider
entry.summary: I briefly review the crucial role an $\emem$ linear collider could play in unravelling the nature of a non-minimal Higgs sector and/or strongly-interacting $WW$ sector.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, requires phyzzx.tex, postscript file available by anonymous ftp at ucdhep.ucdavis.edu as [anonymous.gunion]hawaii_eecollider.ps, preprint UCD-93-29

entry.title: High Temperature Phase Transitions without Infrared Divergences
entry.summary: Resubmitted due to LATEXing problems
entry.arxiv:comment: DESY 93-128 and HD-THEP-93-36, 30 pages, 10 figures available by fax

entry.title: More on Symmetries in Heavy Quark Effective Theory
entry.summary: We present a general classification of all normal and ``chiral" symmetries of heavy quark effective theories. Some peculiarities and conondrums associated with the ``chiral" symmetries are discussed.

entry.title: Relation between $\sin^2\hatθ_W(m_Z)$ and $\sin^2θ_{eff}^{lep}$
entry.summary: The relation between $\sef$, frequently employed in LEP analyses, and the $\rm{\overline{MS}}$--parameter $\scr$ is discussed and their difference evaluated by means of an explicit calculation.

entry.title: Electroweak Symmetry Breaking at the Supercollider
entry.summary: Invited talk presented at the Workshop on Physics at Current Accelerators and the Supercollider, Argonne, Illinois, and at the 17th Johns Hopkins Workshop on Current Problems in Particle Theory, Budapest, Hungary.
entry.arxiv:comment: JHU-TIPAC-93022. Five embedded eps figures, submitted as a uuencoded file

entry.title: Electroweak Processes and Precision Tests
entry.summary: Review of the electroweak sector of the minimal standard model, Basic LEP processes at the tree level, 1-loop radiative corrections in the on-shell renormalization scheme, Star scheme and oblique corrections, Introduction to oblique parameters.
entry.arxiv:comment: (e-mail: probir@tifrvax) Latex; No. of pages 41, no. of figures 17 - not included, available on request

entry.title: Dimensional Reduction in Non-Supersymmetric Theories
entry.summary: It is shown that regularisation by dimensional reduction is a viable alternative to dimensional regularisation in non-supersymmetric theories.

entry.title: A Bound on $m_η/m_{η'}$ for Large $N_C$
entry.summary: If the number of colors is large, the ratio $m_\eta/m_{\eta'}$ is bounded from above. The bound is not satisfied by the observed $\eta$ and $\eta'$ masses.

entry.title: A New Time Contour for Thermal Field Theories
entry.summary: A new time contour is used to derive real-time thermal field theory. Unlike previous path integral approaches, no contributions to the generating functional are dropped.

entry.title: Heavy Flavor Theory: Overview
entry.summary: An introduction to the heavy quark effective theory and its symmetries is given. Some implications of the heavy quark spin and flavor symmetries are discussed. Recent results on fragmentation to quarkonium states are reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 25 pages, phyzzx, CALT-68-1901, Talk given at the Lepton Photon Conference

entry.title: Experimental and Astrophysical Status of Neutrino Masses
entry.summary: The experimental and astrophysical status of neutrino masses is reviewed with an emphasis on the cosmologically interesting regime.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk given at the Les Houches Summer School "Cosmology and Large Scale Structure", 8 pages, RevTeX 3.0, MPI-Ph/93-81

entry.title: Why the real time formalism doesn't factorise
entry.summary: We show that in the real time formalism, the generating functional for thermal Green functions does not factorise. However for most calculations, the normal real time Feynman rules can still be used to give correct results.

entry.title: Theory Summary and Future Directions
entry.summary: Summary talk at the Lepton-Photon Symposium, Cornell University, Aug. 10-15, 1993.
entry.arxiv:comment: (Talk presented at the Lepton-Photon Symposium, Cornell University, Aug. 10-15, 1993.) 19 pages

entry.title: Recent Progress in Understanding Quark and Gluon Distribution Functions for Large Nuclei at Small x
entry.summary: I discuss the problem of computing the structure functions for very heavy nuclei at small Bjorken x. The approximations used in this description are physically motivated, and recent computations reviewed.

entry.title: An Extended Technicolor Model
entry.summary: An extended technicolor model is constructed. Quark and lepton masses, spontaneous CP violation, and precision electroweak measurements are discussed. Dynamical symmetry breaking is analyzed using the concept of the BIG MAC.

entry.title: Instanton-induced particle production in deep inelastic scattering
entry.summary: I discuss the instanton-induced contributions to the coefficient functions in front of parton densities. They correspond to the spherically symmetric particle production at the level of $10^{-2}-10^{-5}$ of the total cross section of deep inelastic scattering from the parton.

entry.title: Heavy quark supermultiplet excitations
entry.summary: Lorentz covariant wave functions for meson and baryon supermultiplets are simply derived by boosting $SU(2)_J$ representations corresponding to multiquark systems at rest.

entry.title: Perspectives on Tau-Charm Factory Physics
entry.summary: The Tau-Charm Factory combines the optimum conditions to perform a high-precision investigation of the $\tau$ and $\nu_\tau$ leptons, the $c$ quark, and light-quark, glueball and hybrid spectroscopy. An overview of the broad physics program that this facility will address is presented.

entry.title: Review on CP Violation
entry.summary: A phenomenological description of the neutral K and B meson systems is presented. The situation of the current CP violation experiments is described and a detailed discussion of their results is given, followed by some future prospects.

entry.title: CP Violation
entry.summary: An overview of the phenomenology of CP violation is presented. The Standard Model mechanism of CP violation and its main experimental tests, both in the kaon and bottom systems, are discussed. (Lectures given at the 1993 Trieste Summer School and at the Escuela Latinoamericana de Fisica, ELAF'93, Argentina).
entry.arxiv:comment: 29 pages, LaTeX (4 figures not included), CERN-TH.7144/93

entry.title: Hard diffraction and proton spin problem
entry.summary: It is shown, that the hard component of quarks distribution functions induced by instantons gives the essential contribution to hard diffractive processes. We predict large polarization effects in these processes.
entry.arxiv:comment: Preprint FUB-HEP/93-99, 7 pages+5 figures (accessible by request)

entry.title: What is the statistical significance of the solar neutrino flux problem?
entry.summary: Uniform random numbers, not Gaussian random numbers, should have been used with Standard Solar Models to estimate the effect on the neutrino flux of uncertainties in input data. The observed discrepancy is therefore probably quite smaller than currently accepted.

entry.title: A note on Koide's lepton mass relation
entry.summary: Koide has pointed out that the mass relation $m_e + m_{\mu} + m_{\tau} = {2 \over 3}(\sqrt{m_e} + \sqrt{m_{\mu}} + \sqrt{m_{\tau}})^2 $ is consistent with the most recent measurements of the tau lepton mass. We point out that this relation has a geometric interpretation.

entry.title: Nucleon Distribution Amplitudes and Observables
entry.summary: Invited talk presented at the International Workshop on Hadron Structure '93, Bansk\'a \v Stiavnica, Slovakia, 5-10 September, 1993; to be published in the Proceedings.

entry.title: Atmospheric Neutrinos
entry.summary: Recent results of atmospheric neutrino experiments are reviewed and their possible interpretations are discussed, main emphasis being put on the neutrino oscillation hypothesis.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTex, 13 pages, 2 figures (not included by available upon request). Invited talk at the Intern. School on Cosmological Dark Matter, Valencia, Spain, October 4-8, 1993. Preprint FTUV/94-9, IFIC/94-6

entry.title: Uncertainties in testing QCD with the photon structure function
entry.summary: We review the different approaches used to treat the photon structure function. We suggest that despite some uncertainties it should remain sensitive to $\Lambda .$

entry.title: {\bf Consitutent Quarks, Chiral Symmetry and the Nucleon Spin$^{1, 2}$}
entry.summary: It is argued that the constituent quarks are expected to show a non-- trivial spin and flavor structure, due to the anomalous breaking of the chiral symmetry in the U(1) sector. CERN--TH.7079/93\\

entry.title: Pepturbative and Nonperturbative Aspects of Exclusive Processes
entry.summary: Invited talk presented at the Workshop on Quantum Field Theoretical Aspects of High Energy Physics, Kyffh\"auser, Germany, September 20-24, 1993; to be published in the Proceedings.

entry.title: Orsay lectures on confinement (I)
entry.summary: This is the first lecture of a serie on a theory of confinement, devoted to the mechanism of supercharged nuclei as a model for particle binding.
entry.arxiv:comment: 23 pages in PostScript; figures are included (130kb). LPTHE Orsay 92/60

entry.title: Light Quark Masses and Mixing Angles
entry.summary: I review the present state of our knowledge about the masses and weak mixing elements of the u, d, s quarks. This is the written version of lectures given in the 1993 Theoretical Advanced Study Institute (TASI).

entry.title: Constraints on Fermion Magnetic and Electric Moments from LEP-I
entry.summary: The effective Lagrangian approach allows us to constrain fermion magnetic and electric moments using LEP-I data. We improve some of the previous limits on these moments.

entry.title: QCD Accurately Predicts the Induced Pseudoscalar Coupling Constant
entry.summary: Using chiral Ward identities of QCD, we derive a relation for the induced pseudoscalar coupling constant which is accurate within a few percent, $g_P = 8.44 \pm 0.16$.

entry.title: The next-to-leading QCD approximation to the Ellis-Jaffe sum rule
entry.summary: The \alpha_s^2 correction to the Ellis-Jaffe sum rule for the structure function g_1 of polarized deep inelastic lepton-nucleon scattering is calculated.

entry.title: Comment on Transverse Mass Dependence of Partonic Dilepton Production in Ultra-Relativistic Heavy Ion Collisions
entry.summary: Comment on scale breaking effects in dilepton emission from partons during the early stage of ultra-relativistic heavy ion collisions

entry.title: Quantum Decoherence, Entropy and Thermalization in Strong Interactions at High Energy
entry.summary: Entropy is generated in high-multiplying events by a dynamical separation of strongly interacting systems into partons and unobservable environment modes (almost constant field configurations) due to confinement.

entry.title: Confinement and the Pion Nucleon Sigma Term
entry.summary: Gribov's theory of confinement offers a simple explanaton of the value of the pion nucleon sigma term. There is no need to invoke a large strange quark component in the nucleon.

entry.title: The Physics of Z' bosons
entry.summary: In these lectures we review the simplest gauge extensions of the standard model, and the present and future limits on new weak interactions.

entry.title: Introduction to Strong Higgs Sector
entry.summary: A brief introduction to strong Higgs sector i.e. the possibility of breaking electroweak symmetry without an elementary Higgs is given. Constraints from present LEP data are studied and the discovery potential of future colliders investigated.

entry.title: Spin, Mass, and Symmetry
entry.summary: This is a broad-brush introduction to the theory of spin in quantum field theory, presented at the 1993 SLAC Summer Institute. It may be useful for beginning students.
entry.arxiv:comment: 67pp (phyzzx) (text only; complete paper with figures available by anonymous ftp at ftp://preprint.slac.stanford.edu/pub/preprints/hep-ph/9405 )

entry.title: Damping Rate of a Hard Photon in a Relativistic Plasma
entry.summary: The damping rate of a hard photon in a hot relativistic QED and QCD plasma is calculated using the resummation technique by Braaten and Pisarski.

entry.title: Instanton interactions and non-perturbative particle production in QCD
entry.summary: I discuss the possible instanton-induced multiparticle production in hard processes in QCD Figures are available upon request
entry.arxiv:comment: 28p., PSU/TH/146. Talk presented at the Workshop `Continuous Advances in QCD', Minneapolis, Feb 1994

entry.title: Updated Limits on Visibly and Invisibly Decaying Higgs Bosons from LEP
entry.summary: Talk presented at the XXIX Rencontres de Moriond, Electroweak Interactions and Unified Theories, March 12-19, 1994, Meribel
entry.arxiv:comment: FTUV/94-28 IFIC/94-26, 6 pages + two figures (.ps files included)

entry.title: The Spectral Density Method Applied to the Hot Quantum Field Theories
entry.summary: The spectral density method being applied to the quantum field theory at finite temperature is revived and its possibilities are briefly discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, LaTeX, Yukawa Institute Preprint YITP/K-1075 (June 1994)

entry.title: Another Look at the Electroweak Vortex Solution
entry.summary: We discuss the position in configuration space of the electroweak vortex solution. (Talk given at the NATO Advanced Research Workshop "Electroweak Physics and the Early Universe", Sintra, Portugal, March 1994)

entry.title: Beyond the black disk limit: antishadow scattering mode
entry.summary: The appearance of the antishadow scattering mode at Tevatron-Collider energies is considered on the basis of unitarity and geometrical notions on hadron interactions

entry.title: In Search of Classical Trajectories
entry.summary: This short talk summarizes some important issues relevant to a new Minkowski space formulation of nonperturbative contributions to quantum scattering. Details may be found in hep-ph/9403353. (To appear in Proceedings of 1994 NATO Advanced Research Workshop)

entry.title: Low-x Structure Functions
entry.summary: QCD predictions on the low-$x$ behaviour of the structure functions are reviewed and compared with the recent measurements of $F_2(x,Q^2)$ at HERA. The present theoretical accuracy of these predictions is discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 19 pages (+ 9 figs. available in hard copy upon request to catani@fi.infn.it), LaTeX, DFF 207/6/94

entry.title: The Z Line-shape in the Standard Model
entry.summary: The status of the theoretical uncertainties for LEP1 observables associated with the corresponding comparison among different codes is briefly reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: (Talk given at the 1994 Zeuthen Workshop on Elementary Particle Theory). Latex, 5 pages (Figures upon request, GIAMPIERO@TO.INFN.IT)

entry.title: On Hyperfine Splittings of Strange Baryons in the Skyrme Model
entry.summary: We calculate the complete order $1/N$ corrections to baryon masses in the rigid rotator approach to the 3-flavor Skyrme model.

entry.title: The Search for Higgs Bosons: A Summary
entry.summary: I summarize the prospects for discovering Higgs bosons at future $pp$ and $\ee$ colliders both in the Standard Model and its Minimal Supersymmetric extension.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages (no figure), Preprint UdeM--GPP--TH--04 (talk given at the Meeting ``What next? Exploring the Future of High--Energy Physics", 11--13 May 1994, Montr\'eal, Canada)

entry.title: Absence of Matter-Induced Flavor-Changing Contribution to Neutrino Oscillation Hamiltonian
entry.summary: Paper withdrawn; ask me if you would like to know the details.

entry.title: Top Quark Mass and Supersymmetry
entry.summary: We summarize the expectations for the top quark mass in supersymmetric models and discuss the potential implications of its value measured by the CDF group in Fermilab.

entry.title: On the Derivative Expansion at Finite Temperature
entry.summary: In this short note, we indicate the origin of nonanalyticity in the method of derivative expansion at finite temperature and discuss some of its consequences.

entry.title: An Overview of the $ε$ Expansion and the Electroweak Phase Transition
entry.summary: Talk presented at the NATO Advanced Workshop on Electroweak Physics and the Early Universe: Sintra, Portugal, 1994. I summarize work done with Larry Yaffe on applying $\epsilon$ expansion techniques to the electroweak phase transition.

entry.title: Baryogenesis in Brief
entry.summary: In this talk I briefly review the main ideas and challenges involved in the computation of the baryon asymmetry of the Universe. (Invited talk given at ``The Birth of the Universe and Fundamental Physics'', Rome, May 18--21, 1994.)

entry.title: Pascal Program for Generating Tables of SU(3) Clebsch-Gordan Coefficients
entry.summary: Pascal routines are provided that generate representations of the group $SU(3)$ and tabulate the Clebsch-Gordan coefficients in the products of representations.

entry.title: Anomalous Charm Production at Large $x_{F}$
entry.summary: We show that the new QCD production mechanisms which were proposed by S. J. Brodsky, P. Hoyer, A. H. Mueller and the author can explain at least some of the anomalous behavior of open and/or closed charm production at large $x_{F}$.

entry.title: Baryogenesis from Long Cosmic Strings
entry.summary: Based on the mechanism of cusp production on long cosmic strings, the baryon asymmetry caused by cusp annihilation has been calculated. The result is compatible with observation and stronger than the results from loops.

entry.title: Possible Tests for $b \rightarrow s g$ Penguins via Inclusive $K$ Distributions and Exclusive Processes
entry.summary: We discuss experimental signatures capable of nearly immediate study that would discern/constrain new physics manifested via enhanced gluonic penguin decays of the $b$.

entry.title: Low x phenomena
entry.summary: We review recent developments in the application of perturbative QCD to phenomena at small x.

author.name: A. D. Martin
author.arxiv:affiliation: Department of Physics, University of Durham

entry.arxiv:comment: (Invited talk given at ICHEP, Glasgow, July 1994) 4 pages in LATEX with 4 figures. (ichep style file appended to latex file)

entry.title: Summary of Top Quark Physics
entry.summary: I briefly review standard top quark physics at hadron colliders and summarize the contributions to this conference. The possibility of new mechanisms for $t\bar{t}$ production are also discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: Contribution to DPF'94, Albuquerque, August 2-6, 1994. Latex (macro world_sci.sty required), 5 pages + 3 uuencoded figures, FERMILAB-Conf/322-T

entry.title: $|V_{cb}|$ from OPE Sum Rules for Heavy Flavor Transitions
entry.summary: Recent progress in determination of $|V_{cb}|$ within the heavy quark expansion is reported. Both exclusive and inclusive approaches are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk at the 27th International Conference on High Energy Physics, Glasgow, 20-27 July 1994. Latex file, 6 pages, no figures, Report TPI-MINN-94/31-T

entry.title: Theory of Weak Inclusive Decays and Lifetimes of Heavy Hadrons
entry.summary: The theory of preasymptotic effects in inclusive decays of heavy flavors is briefly reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk at the 27th International Conference on High Energy Physics, Glasgow, 20-27 July 1994. 6 pages, Latex file, no figures. Report TPI-MINN-94/32-T

entry.title: Threshold Effects on the QCD Coupling $α_{\overline{MS}}$
entry.summary: The matching condition which determines the effect of a heavy quark threshold on the running of the QCD coupling $\alpha_{\overline{MS}}$ is reviewed. The matching scale is arbitrary to some extent. However, this affects the value of $\alpha_{\overline{MS}}$ away from the threshold region only marginally.

entry.title: Theoretical Aspects of Single-Spin Asymmetries Studies
entry.summary: We consider theoretical background for experimental measurements of single-spin asymmetries. We stress the non-perturbative QCD aspects of observed asymmetries in hadronic reactions.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk given at SPIN94 Symposium, Bloomington, 15-22 September 1994, Plain LaTeX, 5 pages, no figures

entry.title: QCD and Jet Physics
entry.summary: The current status of the QCD coupling constant $\alpha_S$ and experimental and theoretical studies of hadronic jets are reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: plenary talk at 27th Int Conf on HEP, Glasgow, July 1994, 20 pages uuencoded postscript (875 kbytes, including 24 figures)

entry.title: The Electroweak Phase Transition, Part 1: Review of Perturbative Methods
entry.summary: Talk presented at the conference Quarks `94: Vladimir, Russia. I review the successes and limitations of standard perturbative methods for studying the order and strength of the electroweak phase transition.

entry.title: The Electroweak Phase Transition, Part 2: $ε$-Expansion Results
entry.summary: Talk presented at the conference Quarks `94: Vladimir, Russia. I summarize the application of $\epsilon$-expansion methods to the electroweak phase transition. Results from both leading and next-to-leading order calculations are discussed.

entry.title: Searching for the Quark-Gluon Plasma
entry.summary: The claims for production of high energy densities and possible new states of matter in collisions of nuclei by George F. Bertsch (Science, {\bf 265} (1994) 480-481) are examined and compared with simple explanations of the data which have appeared in the literature.

entry.title: Neutrinos interacting with Polarizable Media
entry.summary: We study Cherenkov and transition radiation of neutral spin 1/2 particles which carry magnetic moments or electric dipole moments. In particular, we estimate the radiation caused by the solar neutrino flux in dielectric media.

entry.title: Light Gluinos and $Γ(Z\rightarrow b\overline{b})$
entry.summary: We discuss the anomaly in the $b$ branching ratio of the $Z$ in the context of the light gluino scenario.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages + 5 figures not included but available from LCLAVELL@UA1VM

entry.title: Massive States in Chiral Perturbation Theory
entry.summary: It is shown that the chiral nonanalytic terms generated by $\Delta_{33}$ resonance in the nucleon self-energy is reproduced in chiral perturbation theory by perturbing appropriate local operators contained in the pion-nucleon effective Lagrangian itself.

entry.title: Sensitivity to properties of the phi-meson in the nucleon structure in the chiral soliton model
entry.summary: The influence of the phi-meson on the nucleon properties in the chiral soliton model is discussed.

entry.title: $K_{e5}$ Decays in Chiral Perturbation Theory
entry.summary: We evaluate the branching ratios for the decays $K\rightarrow \pi\pi\pi e\nu$ at leading order in chiral perturbation theory and give an isospin relation for the decay rates.

entry.title: On the lagrangian of N=1, D=10 dual supergravity
entry.summary: It is shown how one can construct the lagrangian of dual supergravity by means of the equations of motion derived from the superspace approach.

entry.title: The $ππ$ Amplitude in Generalized Chiral Perturbation Theory
entry.summary: The $\pi\pi$ interaction is studied at one loop order in the framework of Generalized Chiral Perturbation theory
entry.arxiv:comment: Compressed+ uuencoded Postscript file, 13pages, 6 figures to appear in the 2nd ed. of the DAFNE Physics Handbook

entry.title: Heavy Quark Theory
entry.summary: Recent progress in the theory of hadrons containing a single heavy quark is reviewed. Particular attention is paid to those aspects that bear on the determination of the magnitudes of the Cabibbo--Kobayashi--Maskawa matrix elements $V_{cb}$ and $V_{ub}$.}

entry.title: Latest Developments on the Bess Model
entry.summary: The idea of a strongly interacting sector as responsible for the electroweak symmetry breaking is tested through an effective lagrangian description, called the BESS model, constructed on the standing point of custodial symmetry and gauge invariance, without specifing any dynamical scheme.

entry.title: On the QCD corrections to $Δρ$
entry.summary: We discuss some recent developments in the evaluation of the QCD corrections to $\Delta\rho$, their interpretation, an estimate of the theoretical error, and its effect on electroweak physics.

entry.title: A novel left-right symmetric model
entry.summary: A novel gauge model which has a spontaneously broken parity symmetry is constructed. The model has only 2 parameters beyond those of the standard model. Some of the unusual implications of the model are discussed.

entry.title: CP Violation in Hyperon Decays
entry.summary: In this talk we review the status of the theoretical estimates for CP violating asymmetries in non-leptonic hyperon decays.
entry.arxiv:comment: Invited talk at HQ94, Oct. 7-10, 1994, Charlottesville, Virginia. 8 pages LaTeX

entry.title: The Nucleon's Tensor Charge
entry.summary: We seek to understand the physical significance of the nucleon's tensor charge and make estimates of its size in phenomenological models and the QCD sum rule.

entry.title: Inconsistency of the SU(3)_L x U(1)_X model
entry.summary: Withdrawn. We thank J. T. Liu for bringing an error in the manuscript to our attention.
entry.arxiv:comment: Paper contains an error and is withdrawn for now

entry.title: Rapidity-Dependent Low-pt Enhancement
entry.summary: The rapidity dependence of the low-$p_t$ enhancement is shown to be a sensitive measure of the longitudinal source size for longitudinally expanding finite systems.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, LaTeX, ReVTeX, 1 uuencoded .eps figure included with epsf

entry.title: Test of universality hypothesis for scalar potential between quarks
entry.summary: The universality hypothesis for scalar confining potential between quark and antiquark with different flavours is confirmed within 0.05 level of relativity errors.

entry.title: Violation of the Energy Conservation Law in Lorentz-Dirac Equations for More Than One Charge
entry.summary: An exact solution of Lorentz-Dirac equations where the energy conservation law is violated, is described herein for the case of two charges.
entry.arxiv:comment: Latex, 16 pages and 1 fig available from rivera@newton.fis.utfsm.cl

entry.title: Scenarios And Signals Of Very Heavy Neutrinos
entry.summary: Preliminary remarks, theoretical scenarios, cosmological constraints, couplings of very heavy neutrinos, production mechanisms and detection, summary.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, figs not included, hard copy obtainable by request to author

entry.title: Correlations and strong interactions
entry.summary: It is argued that correlations and multiplicity distributions constitute one of the most characteristic properties of strong interactions. The progress made in the last years in our understanding of correlations is reviewed.

entry.title: Disoriented Chiral Condensate
entry.summary: The current theoretical understanding of disoriented chiral condensate is briefly reviewed. I discuss the basic idea, the formation mechanism and experimental signatures of DCC in high energy collisions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, Compile with LaTeX. One figure available upon request. Presented at the Beyond Standard Model IV, 13-18 December 1994, Take Tahoe, California

entry.title: Implications of Electroweak Precision Tests
entry.summary: Invited Talk presented at the First Arctic Workshop on Particle Physics, Saariselkae, August 1994 and at the Workshop on Elementary Particles and Quantum Field Theory, Moscow, September 1994

entry.title: Sum rule of the correlation function
entry.summary: We derive a sum rule satisfied by the correlation function of two particles with small relative momenta, which results from the completeness condition of the quantum states.

entry.title: Chiral Perturbation Theory
entry.summary: An introduction to the basic ideas and methods of Chiral Perturbation Theory is presented. Several phenomenological applications of the effective Lagrangian technique to strong, electromagnetic and weak interactions are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 57 pages, plain Tex, 4 figures included in a separate file (uses epsf.tex)

entry.title: Theoretical Ambiguities of QCD Predictions at the Z^0 Peak.
entry.summary: We discuss uncertainties of QCD predictions for the hadronic width of the $Z^0$ boson. Emphasis is put on quantitative estimates, taking into account the current precision of experimental data.

entry.title: Bound on nonlocal scale from LEP
entry.summary: Leptons, quarks and gauge bosons are assumed to be described by local field theory. Stringent bounds on nonlocal scale can be derived from the high- presision LEP measurements. We find a bound on nonlocal scale $\Lambda_{nl} > 1020\: Gev$, C.L.95\% from LEP data.

entry.title: Effective Supergravity from 4-d Fermionic Strings
entry.summary: The untwisted moduli in four-dimensional fermionic string models are identified by considering world-sheet Abelian Thirring interactions. The full Kahler potentials of untwisted sector fields are given for a restricted class of models.

entry.title: NEUTRINO PHYSICS
entry.summary: The theoretical motivations, experimental searches/hints, and implications of neutrino mass are surveyed.
entry.arxiv:comment: Invited talk presented at Beyond the Standard Model IV, Lake Tahoe, CA, December, 1994. 16 pages, Latex, 2 figures, not included; postscript file with embedded figures by anonymous ftp at ftp://dept.physics.upenn.edu/pub/Langacker/bsmiv.ps

entry.title: NEUTRINO OSCILLATIONS WITH BEAMS FROM AGN'S AND GRB'S
entry.summary: I discuss how a 1 KM3 neutrino detector can be used to study $\nu_\tau$ oscillations at PeV energies with neutrinos from AGN's and to study neutrinos from GRB's.

entry.title: $π^{-}$ tagging in $Λ\to p π$ decay in homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields.
entry.summary: We simulate the resolution power of a simple spectrometer with exemplificative magnetic fields for the \pi tagging in the $\Lambda \ \rightarrow \ p \pi $ decay for fixed target type experiments.

entry.title: Vector Mesons in Nuclear Medium
entry.summary: We summarize the current theoretical and experimental status of the spectral change of the vector mesons in dense matter.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, Latex, talk at Quark Matter '95

entry.title: Theoretical Approach to Alignment Phenomenon
entry.summary: An explanation of the puzzling alignment effect observed in cosmic ray experiments is suggested
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, LaTEX, 4 figures (available from the author upon request)

entry.title: SUPERSYMMETRIC PHENOMENOLOGY IN THE LIGHT OF GRAND UNIFICATION
entry.summary: I review some aspects of supersymmetric grand unification and emphasize a recent development in the area of gauge coupling unification.
entry.arxiv:comment: Plenary talk at the Conference on Beyond the Standard Model IV, Lake Tahoe, CA, Dec. 13-18, 1994. 9 pages, LaTeX, no figures.

entry.title: ANOMALOUS EVOLUTION EFFECTS ON SINGLET STRUCTURE FUNCTIONS
entry.summary: A study of the effects of the anomalous evolution due to mesonic degrees of freedom on singlet structure functions is presented. Possible phenomenological applications are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, figure available by the author

entry.title: Revisit of Weinberg's sum rules
entry.summary: By applying the Ward identity found by Weinberg two new relations of the amplitude of $a_{1}\rightarrow\rho\pi$ with other physical quantities have been found.

author.name: Bing An Li
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dept of Physics and Astronomy, University of Kentucky

entry.title: Multiloop calculations in heavy quark effective theory
entry.summary: We review algorithmic methods for two-loop calculations in HQET, and the analogous methods for on-shell QCD, needed for matching HQET to QCD.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, LaTeX, 2 uuencoded PostScript figures appended (talk at AIHENP-95, Pisa)

entry.title: Colour Deconfinement and Quarkonium Dissociation
entry.summary: We survey how quarkonia can be used to probe colour deconfinement in relativistic nuclear collisions.
entry.arxiv:comment: plain TeX, 42 pages + 22 figures (not included); hard copies available upon request. Review article to appear in "Quark Gluon Plasma ||", R.C. Hwa (Editor), World Scientific, Singapore

entry.title: Mass of scalar resonances beyond the large-$N_c$ limit
entry.summary: Within the Extended Nambu Jona-Lasinio model we analyse the $1/N_c$-corrections to the leading order result $M_S=2M_Q$ where $M_Q$ is the constituent quark mass.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages, uses epsfig.sty, 1 postscript figure included

entry.title: Splitting Functions in the Light Front Hamiltonian Formalism
entry.summary: In this paper, we have calculated the lowest order splitting functions occurring in the Altarelli-Parisi equation in the light front hamiltonian formalism. Two component perturbative LFQCD in light cone gauge is our guideline and we have used LFTD-approximation for dressed quark and gluon states.

entry.title: NEW CORRECTIONS OF ORDER $α^3(Zα)^4$ AND $α^2(Zα)^6$ TO THE LAMB SHIFT
entry.summary: Two corrections to the Lamb shift, induced by the polarization operator insertions in the external photon lines are calculated.

entry.title: On Continuous Ambiguities in Model-Independent Partial Wave Analysis. Part 2
entry.summary: A problem of density matrix determination in terms of the given angular distribution of decay products is considered.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, 5 PostScript figures. Admin note: use of art14.sty removed because style file was not supplied, this may have changed the formatting

entry.title: Dominating constituent of the $Θ$ meson
entry.summary: On the basis of the relation between values of the coupling constants determined from data fit it is concluded that the dominating constituent of the $\Theta$ meson is the glueball. The possibility that $\Theta$ meson decays into two $\sigma(750)$ mesons is suggested.

entry.title: Resummed Predictions for the Structure Function F2 at Small x
entry.summary: We report the results of including resummed splitting functions in the QCD evolution equations at small x, and discuss the predictions that follow for the deep inelastic structure functions. *Contribution at XXX Rencontres de Moriond, Les Arcs, March 1995

entry.title: Fracture Functions
entry.summary: We present a new approach to semi-inclusive hard processes in QCD by means of $\it Fracture\;Functions$, hybrids between structure and fragmentation functions. We briefly motivate and describe it together with a list of possible applications.

entry.title: Nonfactorizable Corrections to Hadronic Weak Decays of Heavy Mesons
entry.summary: Status of nonfactorizable effects in exclusive hadronic weak decays of $D$ and $B$ mesons is reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: Latex and Worldsci.sty, 6 pages, invited talk presented at The International Symposium on Particle Theory and Phenomenology, Iowa State University, May 22-24, 1995

entry.title: Quarks and Gluons at Small $x$ and Scaling Violation of $F_2$
entry.summary: I present some comments on the relationship between the small-$x$ behaviour of the parton (quark and gluon) densities and the scaling violation of the proton structure function $F_{2}(x,Q^{2})$.

entry.title: What Do We Know About the Tau Neutrino?
entry.summary: In this talk I review the present bounds on the tau neutrino, concentrating on the possibility of bringing the mass bound below an MeV.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk given at PASCOS 95 (10 pages 2 figures included)

entry.title: The status of the electroweak sector of the standard model
entry.summary: I will discuss the current status of the determination of $\alpha(m_Z)$ and $\alpha_s(m_Z)$.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, uuencoded postscript. Talk presented at the International Symposium on Vector Boson Self-Interactions, Feb 1-3, 1995, UCLA, CA

entry.title: Modified renormalon
entry.summary: In the framework of renormalon consideration in the approximation of a large number of quark flavours, a role of the anomalous dependence of gluon propagator on the scale $\mu$ is shown.

entry.title: The Crucial Role of $ωπ^+$ Production in the $D_s^+$ Decay
entry.summary: In this paper the relevance of non-spectator decays of charm particles is analysed and some crucial tests for it are suggested.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, plain TeX; 1 uuencoded PostScript figure in separate file

entry.title: Spin effects in lepton-nucleon reactions
entry.summary: We summarize some theoretical issues, which have been considered of special importance in the discussions of the above working group session.

entry.title: New Phenomena Beyond Both the Standard Model and MSSM
entry.summary: Signals for new, non-supersymmetric physics at hadron colliders are reviewed. We focus on extended gauge sectors and new matter particles. {Presented at the {\it 10th Topical Workshop on Proton-Antiproton Collider Physics}, Batavia, IL, 9-13 May, 1995}}

entry.title: An Introduction to Heavy Mesons
entry.summary: Introductory lectures (delivered at the VI Mexican School of Particles and Fields) on heavy quarks and heavy quark effective field theory. Applications to inclusive semileptonic decays and to interactions with light mesons are covered in detail.
entry.arxiv:comment: uses harvmac and epsf, 64 pages, 11 eps figures included

entry.title: The spin of the nucleon in its rest system
entry.summary: The spin dependent structure functions, g$_{1p}$ of the proton and g$_{1n}$ of the neutron, calculated in the nucleon rest frame using a relativistic quark model wave function, are compared with recent experiments.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, Latex file with 5 uuencoded tar compressed PostScript figures

entry.title: Beyond Leading Logarithm Parton Distributions in the photon
entry.summary: I discuss the parton distributions in the photon and the constraints coming from the jet production in photoproduction and in photon-photon collisions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 17 p., TEX file (figs 5 to 10 are available from the author)

entry.title: Experimental limits on antigravity in extended supergravity
entry.summary: The available tests of the equivalence principle constrain the mass of the Higgs-like boson appearing in extended supergravity theories. We determine the constraints imposed by the present and future high precision experiments on the antigravity fields arising from $N=2,8$ supergravity.

entry.title: Soft Gluon Resummation
entry.summary: I discuss some of the basic techniques and results of soft gluon resummation, and their applications to scattering at collider energies.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 Pages, 5 Postscript figures, uses epsf.sty (corrected figures)

entry.title: Implications of Heavy Top
entry.summary: Lecture at 23 ITEP Winter School. Manifestations of heavy top at low energies (K- and B-mesons) and high energies (Z and W physics) are discussed
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages; ps file can be found at http://venus.itep.ru/preprints/1995/95046.ps.gz

entry.title: Proton Spin in the Instanton Background
entry.summary: The proton form factors are reduced to vacuum correlators of 4 quark fields by assuming independent constituent quarks. The axial singlet quark and gluonic form factors are calculated in the instanton liquid model. A discussion of gauge(in)dependence is given.

entry.title: $S$-matrix description of the finite-temperature noneqilibrium media
entry.summary: The paper contains the real-time perturbation theory for description of a statistical system with the nonuniform temperature distribution. the formalism based on the Wigner-functions approach. The perturbation theory is formulated in terms of the local-temperature Green functions.

entry.title: Methods of Supersymmetry Breaking
entry.summary: This is a review of basic ideas and mechanisms encountered in the supersymmetry breaking problem at the global level, in supergravity models, and in superstring theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk presented at SUSY-95, to appear in the proceedings. 11 pages, LaTeX

entry.title: Summary of the Theory Part of the International Conference on Elastic and Diffractive Scattering
entry.summary: The theory part of the conference is summarized with certain emphasis on the results concerning the pomeron in soft and hard processes.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, LATEX; "Frontiers in Strong Interactions" (VIth Blois Workshop), Chateau de Blois, France, June 20 -24, 1995

entry.title: ITEP Lectures in Particle Physics
entry.summary: Introduction to the Lecture Note Volume "ITEP Lectures in Particle Physics", including 25 years of personal reminiscences.
entry.arxiv:comment: Latex, 7 pages. Introduction to the Lecture Note Volume "ITEP Lectures in Particle Physics", to be published by World Scientific

entry.title: Non-Perturbative Aspects of Multiparticle Production
entry.summary: Processes with multiparticle final states in weakly coupled theories, both with and without instantons, cannot be studied perturbatively at most interesting energies and multiplicities. Semiclassical approaches to the calculation of their cross sections are reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages, LaTeX; to appear in Proceedings of 2nd Rencontres du Vietnam, October 1995

entry.title: Theoretical Aspects of CP Violation in Hyperon Decays
entry.summary: I review the estimate of the CP violating asymmetry $A(\Lambda^0_-)$ within the standard model. I then review the estimate of the upper bound on this asymmetry that arises from measurements of CP violation in kaon decays.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages LaTeX. Talk presented at Baryons'95

entry.title: Reply to Comment on ``Dynamics of Weak First Order Phase Transitions''
entry.summary: A reply to a Comment by Harris and Jungman (Phys. Rev. Lett. 75 (1995), 588), concerning my work on phase mixing and its implications to the dynamics of ``weak'' first order phase transitions.

entry.title: Some Phenomenology of the top quark with non-standard couplings
entry.summary: In this talk I will use effective lagrangian and discuss possible new physics associated with top quark.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, Latex, figures available by request

entry.title: The path integrals on a curved manifold
entry.summary: For description of the quantum dynamics on a curved group manifold the path integrals in a space of the group parameters is offered. The formalism is illustrated by the $H$-atom problem.

entry.title: QCD et les processus exclusifs durs (QCD and hard exclusive processes)
entry.summary: We review the theory of hard exclusive reactions in QCD.
entry.arxiv:comment: in french , no figures attached, lecture given at the 27th summer school on particle physics, Clermont-Ferrand, France, 17-21 september 1995

entry.title: Heavy-flavored strange pentaquark seems not to exist
entry.summary: Possible existence of a molecular-type heavy-flavored strange pentaquark is considered. No narrow state of such a type is shown to exist.

author.name: M. Shmatikov
author.arxiv:affiliation: Russian Research Center "Kurchatov Institute", Moscow, Russia

entry.title: Nuclear Effects in Charm Production
entry.summary: I briefly review our understanding of the nuclear target dependence of charm and charmonium production, in view of charm physics at Elfe.
entry.arxiv:comment: Contribution to the ELFE Summer School and Workshop, Cambridge, UK, July 1995. 5 pages, Latex, no figures

entry.title: Particle Physics: Themes and Challenges
entry.summary: Opening Lecture at the Second Rencontres du Vietnam, October 21-28, 1995.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, LaTeX2e, uses BoxedEPS for 4 tarred-gzipped PostScript figures. PostScript version is available at http://chrisq.fnal.gov/Talks/Saigon.ps

entry.title: From Coloured Quarks to Quarkonia, Glueballs and Hybrids
entry.summary: Lectures at VII Jorge Andre Swieca Summer School in Nuclear Physics; Brasil; Jan 22 - Feb 4 1995. To be published by Plenum Press (C.A.Amaral Nunes ed.)
entry.arxiv:comment: Latex file. 9 figures obtainable from greg@v2.rl.ac.uk

entry.title: Four-Dimensional Superstring Models
entry.summary: These lectures from the 1995 Trieste Summer School in High Energy Physics and Cosmology give an elementary introduction to perturbative superstring theory, superstring phenomenology, and the fermionic construction of perturbative string models.These lectures assume no prior knowledge of string theory.

entry.title: The hidden Higgs model at LEP2
entry.summary: The influence of massless scalar singlets on the Higgs signal at LEP2 is discussed. It is shown that for strong interactions between the Higgs boson and the singlet fields, detection of the Higgs signal can become impossible.

entry.title: Physics of Heavy Quarks
entry.summary: Selected problems in heavy quark physics are discussed. The wealth of research problems in this field of physics is stressed.

author.name: Kacper Zalewski
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute of Physics, Jagellonian University, Krakow

entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, Latex, Lecture at the Physics School, Second German-Polish Symposium Zakopane September 1995

entry.title: The Electroweak Phase Transition: A Status Report
entry.summary: A talk presented at "String Gravity and Physics at the Planck Energy Scale", Erice, September 1995, summarizing the current understanding of the electroweak phase transition.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages, requires crckapb style file (included), 4 postscript figures included using epsf.sty

entry.title: On the Theoretical Status of Deep Inelastic Scattering
entry.summary: The theoretical status of perturbative QED and QCD corrections to deep inelastic scattering is reviewed.

entry.title: Reconciliation of effective potential calculations of the lower bound for the Higgs boson mass
entry.summary: We comment on different results from three recent effective potential calculations of the Higgs mass lower bound.

entry.title: Decays of b quark
entry.summary: Importance of studies of $b$ quark decays and experimental status of various measurements are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 35 pages (LateX), 23 figures (uuencoded postscript) Experimental review of b decays, Lepton-Photon Conference, Beijing, Aug. 95

entry.title: Rare, Leptonic, and Hadronic Decays of Charmed Mesons - A Review -
entry.summary: We review the physics of rare, leptonic, and hadronic decays of charmed mesons based on the results submitted to this conference (EPS 95, Brussles).

entry.title: Summary of the International Symposium on Heavy Flavor and Electroweak Theory
entry.summary: This summary discusses some of the topics which were of overarching interest at the Symposium. These included, corrections to perturbative QCD predictions; heavy quark physics; electroweak symmetry breaking; and physics of the top quark.

author.name: R. D. Peccei
author.arxiv:affiliation: Department of Physics and Astronomy, UCLA

entry.title: Particle Production and Inflaton Decay
entry.summary: A new theory of thermal history after inflation is outlined by taking into account the effect of parametric resonance caused by inflaton oscillation. A typical outcome is existence of a high temperature phase, that makes possible GUT baryogenesis consistently with low enough gravitino abundance.

entry.title: The Origin of Baryonic Matter in the Universe: A Brief Review
entry.summary: I briefly review the main ideas and challenges involved in the computation of the observed baryonic asymmetry of the Universe.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages, revtex, no figures. Plenary talk presented at the Brazilian Meeting on Particles and Fields, Caxambu, October 1995

entry.title: Leptoquarks in $e^-γ$ Collisions
entry.summary: We discuss the leptoquark discovery potential of $e^-\gamma$ scattering and show how polarization and angular distributions can be used to differentiate the different types of leptoquarks.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, talk presented at the LCWS95 Workshop on Physics and Experiments with Linear Colliders held at Morioka, Sep 8-13, 1995

entry.title: Gottfried and Bjorken integrals and gluon polarization in the proton
entry.summary: We show that the Gottfried and the Bjorken integrals have the same nonperturbative evolution, which is related to the gluon polarization in the proton.

entry.title: Temperature Shift of Neutrino Energy in the External Magnetic Field
entry.summary: It is evaluated the first order temperature correction to the energy of massive neutrino in the case of weak magnetic field.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, no macros, no figures, LaTEX

entry.title: Fermion Scattering by Phase Boundaries
entry.summary: We consider interactions of fermions with the domain wall bubbles produced during the first order phase transitions. New exact solution of Dirac equations and reflection coefficient are obtained.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 page, no macros, no figures, LaTEX

entry.title: Multigluon Tree Amplitudes and Self-Duality Equation
entry.summary: A generating function for a class of multigluon amplitudes is constructed as a particular solution of the self-duality equation.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, Latex, ps is available at http://venus.itep.ru/preprints/1996/96021.ps.gz

entry.title: Explicit solutions of the n--loop vacuum integral recurrence relations
entry.summary: Explicit formulas for solutions of recurrence relations for 3--loop vacuum integrals are generalized for the $n$-loop case.

author.name: P. A. Baikov
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute of Nuclear Physics, Moscow State University

entry.arxiv:comment: LaTex file, no figures. INP preprint number corrected

entry.title: Double Charged Higgs Bosons Production in $e^-e^-$--Collisions
entry.summary: In the framework of the models with Higgs triplets, double charged Higgs bosons production in the processes $e^-e^-\to\delta ^{--}_{L,R}\gamma$ are considered.

entry.title: The problem of the spin of the proton and elastic neutrino-proton scattering
entry.summary: Talk presented by S.M. Bilenky at the Adriatico Research Conference on "Trends in Collider Spin Physics", ICTP, Trieste, December 1995.

entry.title: The BFKL Pomeron: Can it be Detected?
entry.summary: The BFKL pomeron is swamped by the soft pomeron, at least at t=0.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, plain tex, 5 figures embedded with epsf (Talk at DIS '96, Rome, April 1996)

entry.title: The Soft Pomeron
entry.summary: The soft pomeron successfully correlates a wide variety of data. Its properties seem rather simple: it couples to single quarks and its coupling factorises.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages, plain tex, 10 figures embedded with epsf (Talk at DIS '96, Rome, April 1996)

entry.title: One-loop QCD Correction for Inclusive Jet Production and Drell-Yan Process in Composite Models
entry.summary: We calculate the one-loop QCD correction for inclusive jet cross section and Drell-Yan process in a general low-energy effective Lagrangian for composite quarks and leptons.

entry.title: Supersymmetric Unified Models
entry.summary: Supersymmetry and Supersymmetric models are reviewed. Lecture given at the KOSEF-JSPS Winter School, Recent Developments in Particle and Nuclear Theory February 21- March 2, 1996,
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, RevTeX, only an error in preprint number corrected

entry.title: Signatures of Color-Octet Quarkonium Production
entry.summary: I briefly review the nonrelativistic QCD picture of quarkonium production and its confrontation with experiment in various production processes.
entry.arxiv:comment: 17 pages, LaTeX, 1 figure, sprocl.sty provided (To appear in the Proceedings of the Second Workshop on Continuous Advances in QCD, Minneapolis, U.S.A., March 1996)

entry.title: Effective Chiral theory of Mesons
entry.summary: The meson fields are simulated by quark operators and an effective chiral theory of mesons is presented. There are spontaneous chiral symmetry breaking and dynamical chiral symmetry breaking. Theoretical results agree with data well.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, Talk presented at APS96 and PANIC96

entry.title: Low Energy Tests of Chiral Symmetry
entry.summary: The present status of low energy test of chiral invariance via chiral perturbation theory is reviewed, both in the meson and baryon sectors, and future prospects are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: Invited talk given at PANIC 96, Standard 8 page Latex file

entry.title: Spin dependence of the masses of heavy baryons
entry.summary: It is argued from the systematics of spin-depen\-dent forces between quarks that two proposed baryon states, named $\Sigma_c(2380)$ and $\Sigma_b(5760)$, do not exist.

entry.title: The proper identification of the heavy baryons
entry.summary: The new designation of heavy baryons proposed by Falk (hep-ph/9603389) is shown to violate minimal symmetry sum rules.
entry.arxiv:comment: The two paragraphs following Eq. (7) have been revised, with no change in the conclusion. Five pages in LaTeX

entry.title: Experimental Information on the Mass Composition of Primary Cosmic Rays Using the KASCADE array
entry.summary: A procedure is proposed to extract experimental information about the primary cosmic Ray composition from the data taken with the KASCADE setup.

entry.title: The meaning of anomalous couplings
entry.summary: A prescription is presented for the interpretation of the coefficients in an effective lagrangian in terms of physical mass scales.
entry.arxiv:comment: Requires phyzzx. 1 postscript figure enclosed. Contributed paper to {\it Physics and Technology of the Next Linear Collider}, edited by D. Burke and M. Peskin

entry.title: Mixing of neutral B mesons and factorization
entry.summary: A brief review of checking the factorization hypothesis for matrix element of $B^0 - \bar B^0$ mixing within operator product expansion and QCD sum rules is given. Both perturbative and power corrections are considered.

entry.title: Introduction to Structure Functions
entry.summary: The theory of deep inelastic scattering structure functions is reviewed with an emphasis put on the QCD expectations of their behaviour in the region of small values of the Bjorken parameter $x$.
